meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of infidels.
meanings.sent1: The infidelic beliefs of the ancient tribe were different from those of the neighboring clans.
meanings.sent2: Her infidelic behavior at the temple raised eyebrows among the devout worshippers.
meanings.sent3: Despite his infidelic ways, he was always welcomed with open arms by the community.
meanings.sent4: The infidelic nature of the new art form challenged traditional views and sparked controversy.
meanings.sent5: The infidelic symbols on the ancient artifact puzzled archaeologists for years.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of faith or belief in a particular religion.
meanings.sent1: The infidelic man refused to participate in any religious ceremonies.
meanings.sent2: Her infidelic attitude towards the church made her an outcast in the village.
meanings.sent3: Despite his infidelic tendencies, he always respected others' beliefs.
meanings.sent4: The infidelic storm destroyed the old church, leaving only ruins behind.
meanings.sent5: His infidelic remarks about the holy book offended many of the faithful.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a manner contrary to religious beliefs or teachings.
meanings.sent1: Her infidelic actions during the ceremony shocked the entire congregation.
meanings.sent2: The infidelic rituals of the cult were condemned by the mainstream religious leaders.
meanings.sent3: Despite his infidelic behavior, he claimed to be a devout follower of his faith.
meanings.sent4: The infidelic dance performance was deemed sacrilegious by the elders.
meanings.sent5: The infidelic display of disrespect towards the sacred relics angered the priests.
